message: package { "ntp": ensure => installed }
BOOM
Been trying to track down a bug on Convore, and just realized it's because the frontend server clocks aren't synchronized
I guess this is just a reminder to sync up those clocks!
So you don't spend an hour tracking down a non-existant problem like I just did :)
Anyone have a favorite NTP server?
nice
I don't know why I starred that.  Maybe because I was happy to get a reply :)
awful bug indeed, especially with inter timezone cluster
hehe :)
convore, where people empathize with each other

@ericflo I've had good success with openntpd (available in Ubuntu). It was written by the OpenBSD guys and is a KISS type server. Doesn't have the bells and whistles that ntpd does, but I look at that as a plus.
at google every server everywhere was set to PST to solve inter-timezone problems. seemed like a good solution
Ah, yes. I was surprised by the PST sync, but just asked a guy who used to work at one of their DCs -- he confirmed it, haha.
